main_definition: To assess or judge the value, quality, importance, ability, or extent of something based on certain criteria.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Assessing someone's performance or work quality
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher will evaluate my essay to determine if I met the assignment requirements.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Determining the cost, value, or price of something
meanings_and_examples.example: We need to evaluate our expenses and revenues to see if we can make a profit.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To judge or form an opinion about someone's character or actions
meanings_and_examples.example: After observing her behavior, I will evaluate whether she is trustworthy or not.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To examine something closely in order to understand it better
meanings_and_examples.example: The doctor will evaluate the patient's symptoms to make an accurate diagnosis.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To calculate or measure using a standard scale or criteria
meanings_and_examples.example: In sports, athletes are often evaluated based on their physical abilities and achievements.
